message.entry: Invalid message connection at output port {0,number,integer} of ''{1}''. Message connections may not be branched and provided to multiple destinations.
Invalid connection between message and signal ports. Output port {0,number,integer} of ''{1}'' is not compatible with input port {2,number,integer} of ''{3}''.
Invalid connection that mixes signals and messages.\nThe type of source and destination for this port are not compatible.\nClick to highlight source and destination.

The message line originating at output port {0,number,integer} of block ''{1}'' is being branched and crosses the boundary of the non-virtual subsystem ''{2}''. Branched message lines cannot cross non-virtual subsystem boundaries.
Duplicate message queue regions named ''{0}'' found. The first reference is in ''{1}''. The second reference is in ''{2}''. Message queues in a given non-virtual hierarchy must have unique names.
Message queue block with name ''{0}'' was not found for the block ''{1}''.
No reader or writer blocks found for message queue block ''{0}'' with name ''{1}''.

Error in block ''{0}''. This block is in a message self loop. A message self loop is formed by directly connecting a message output port and a message input port of the same block.\n\nRemove the loop connections and model the message reception inside the block.
Invalid connection originating from Inport block ''{0}''. The Inport block must not be connected directly to an Outport block because it is receiving message data.
Invalid data attributes set for local queue {0,number,integer} of the "{1}" block. Local priority queues require scalar and non-bus message data.
The block ''{0}'' that is observing messages does not support more than one input port.
The block ''{0}'' that is observing statistics does not support more than one input port.
The statistics port is connected to ''{0}'', which is a Bus Creator or Mux. Either stream these signals to the Simulation Data Inspector or use one observation block for each signal.

The block ''{0}'' does not support the observation of multiple signals when used with SimEvents blocks. Either stream these signals to the Simulation Data Inspector or use one observation block for each signal.
Reception delayed due to message loop
Message output port {0,number,integer} of block ''{1}'' cannot be configured as a linearization point.
Messages cannot be sent to the root-level Outport block ''{0}''. Use a Stateflow chart to convert the message to a signal.
Messages cannot be received from the root-level Inport block ''{0}''. Use a Stateflow chart to generate messages from the signal data at this port.

Messages cannot be sent or received from the Variant Block or Variant Subsystem ''{0}'' because it has been configured to analyze all possible choices and generate preprocessor conditionals. Either change the variant interfaces to be signal-based instead of message-based, or clear the option "Analyze all choices during update diagram and generate preprocessor conditionals" in the Variant Block or Variant Subsystem dialog.
Message queue connected to block ''{0}'' through port {1,number,integer} overflowed during the simulation.
